title: Friends fans freak out after spotting iconic fountain in Hocus Pocus
text:
Most ambitious crossover since Infinity War (Picture: NBC, Disney)

An unlikely connection between Friends and Hocus Pocus has been revealed, after mega observant fans realised that both projects featured the same iconic fountain.

The fountain and house it is in front of are the backdrop for Friends’ opening title series, airing in every single episode with Joey and co. splashing around in the water and dancing in the dark.

If you’ve never wanted to live the Friends dream and recreate this sequence while I’ll Be There For You by The Rembrandts plays, who even are you?

However, eagle-eyed fans (who we assume were getting in the Halloween spirit with a Hocus Pocus rewatch) realised that they’d actually seen the fountain before, as it had previously featured in the Disney Halloween classic.

Appearing in a scene where our heroes think they’ve killed the Sanderson witches in the kiln, fans shared screenshots of the similar scenes all over social media, expressing their shock at the previously unnoticed connection.

‘I was today years old when I found out that the fountain from Hocus Pocus is the same as the one shown in Friends,’ one wrote, while another excitedly said: ‘My mind is officially blown.’

Okay has no one ever noticed that the damn FRIENDS FOUNTAIN is in HOCUS POCUS?!?? pic.twitter.com/DnHlVbPX9p — MDW (@marcwithaC_23) October 10, 2019

Errrmm….mind blown! 🤯 Anyone ever notice that the Friends and Hocus Pocus house are the same? pic.twitter.com/gx8i5SjZ2y — Theataccounts (@Theataccounts) October 9, 2019

Now, as Hocus Pocus was released in 1993 whereas Friends didn’t air until 1994, does that mean we have to start calling it the Hocus Pocus fountain?

Somehow we don’t see that catching on…
